args:
The party learns that it is not Bahamut
controlling Zethia, but someone else's
machinations controlling Bahamut. In
order to sever this connection, the prince's
group and Nedrick join forces to face down
their dragon foe.
Oooo! Look at all the pretty flowers!
To me it's a majestic temple—but if I\nrecall, what we see merely reflects the\nperception of the one viewing it.
Yes. What you see is determined\nby how each of you view Zethia.
So we think she's a bunch of pretty\nscenery and big honkin' buildings?
That sounds like Zethia, all right!
Oh dear. This is so embarrassing...
Yes, I know. I suspect it is because I\ncannot use Bahamut's power here.
It does not appear I am prevented from\nwielding my portion of his power here.
But there is an embodiment of his will\nin this world, so it's probably best not\nto shapeshift carelessly.
Speaking of Bahamut's will, it sounds\nlike the big fella has arrived.
Bahamut, you must listen to me!
It would appear he has no interest in\ntalking.
Does this mean he refused the pact\nwith me after all?
Bahamut's goal has always been to find\na vessel and manifest in this world.
His intent from the beginning was to\ndominate you—a true, shared pact\nwas never an option.
Until this happened, I felt as though\nBahamut HAD accepted our pact.
This is all quite fascinating, but I fear we\nlack the leisure time to spend on such\nerudite ponderings.
We've one way forward now: We show\nBahamut what we're made of and make\nhim see we'll never yield to his control.
If that is the only path open to us,\nthen I will take it.
Come, Bahamut! Come and see as we\nprove our strength to you!
Unbelievable! We laid so many attacks\nupon him, yet he shows not even a\nmoment's sign of faltering.
I suspect the brute force approach alone\nwill not avail us here.
It might just be my imagination, but it\nseems like Bahamut is...suffering.
I've felt that way ever since I was under\nhis sway in the real world.
He seemed to be suffering, as if he were\nnot in control of himself.
Though my pact holds its own share of\npower, the Bahamut I forged it with is still\nthe same being here in Zethia's mind.
And yet, I cannot feel any will from this\nBahamut.
But that would mean... No. It can't be!
Exactly. Someone else's will is interfering.
Meaning that the entity attempting to\ncontrol Zethia is not Bahamut at all,\nbut the one BEHIND Bahamut.
But who—or what—could manage to\nseize control of the Wyrm of Genesis?!
I don't know, but the theory certainly\nexplains the strange out-of-place feeling\nZethia and I are having.
Assuming what you're saying is right,\nwhat can we even do about it?
I have one thought—and the key to it\nis you, {player_name}.
Me? But what can I possibly do?
You're finely attuned to the bonds and flow\nof mana between people and dragons.

Whoever is ultimately responsible for this
is likely using the pact between Zethia
and Bahamut as a sort of cover in which
to conceal themselves.
But you have the talent to identify the\nforeign element hiding in their pact—\nand possibly even eliminate it.
Look, I understand there's a connection\nbetween Zethia and Bahamut, but the\nrest of everything you said? I just...
I'm not intending for you to attempt this\non your own. Rather, I plan to drag the\nresponsible party into the open first.
By having Zethia attempt to shapeshift\ninto Bahamut.
Pretty sure we JUST talked about what\na terrible flipping idea that was, my dude.
Yes, but I only intend for her to START the\nshapeshifting process. The moment she\ndoes, the exchange of mana will activate.
And that's when we'll discover our\n＂foreign influence.＂
Once it's identified, you can cut it out.
Understood. I'll give it a try.
I'm just happy that you're trusting me\nand giving me an important role.
Ugh. Let's not get all milquetoast here.\nThere are some things you can do that\nI cannot—it's as simple as that.
Maybe, but it still makes me happy\nthat you feel that way.
Then just make sure you do the job\nI assigned you to the letter.

The rest of you keep up the attack on
Bahamut. The more power he seeks,
the stronger his connection to Zethia
will likely become.
All right, let's get this done.\nCome on, everyone!
